The Opposition is screwed this time round. By tabling RUU355, PAS has forced everyone to declare their support/objection for their agenda. If DAP objects, tbey lose the Malay vote. If they don't object, they'll lose the non-Malay vote.

There's a difference between supporting the amendment Hadi tabled and stating support for the amendment IF it's amended further to satisfy certain criteria. Don't mistake them for the same thing, even if they're centred around enhancing existing punishments.That being said, enhancement of moral policing is going backwards.

http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...o-table-ruu355/if u are referring to this source. it is very misleading of u to suggest in the thread's title that pkr support RUU355. pkr supports the right of hadi to table. i don't see anything wrong with this. but i find everything wrong about the thread's title.i can support your right to accuse me of murder, doesn't mean i will agree to your accusation if i believe that i didn't do it. pkr is doing the right thing in the spirit of parliament.the article mention below:In a statement, PKR vice-president Shamsul Iskandar Mohd Akin said the party would also adopt Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim’s suggestion for a select committee to be set up to discuss the issue.if anyone tries to say that the above is in anyway suggesting that pkr 'supports the bill but in their own term', that is also misleading too. i dont have to explain more as its self explanatory.this thread is pure ill faith and badly intended.unless thats not the source you guys are discussing.
